content.description: Sit start at the low crimp rail. Move left through a few flat ledges, cross to a right hand sloper, and slap a sloper around the around. Move up through good holds to a large hueco on the left side of the arete and slab your way up. Watch for choss on the slab.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter. Dabby.
content.location: Starts low a few feet left of 3 Star Arete on the Cindy Boulder.
Located in the gap to the right of 3-star arete on the opposite boulder. Starts with a thin left hand crimp and a two/three finger undercling-ish right hand hold.

content.description: Located to the left of three star arete. Sit start matched on lowest rail. Make powerful cruxy moves into a face climb and top out.
content.location: Located to the left of three star arete.

content.description: Starts on two low slopers and moves up through some crimps and into the vertical seam, carefully avoiding the baby cactus growing out of the rock. Crank up and into the large left hand jug that starts the V2 variation. Beware of loose rock at the top.
content.location: On the northwest arete of the Cindy boulder.

content.description: Stand start for 3 Star Arete Sit. Start with the left hand flake then head right and up along the right side pull to a jug rail at the top. Topout then downclimb around the chimney in the back made by a slick boulder.
content.protection: Two to three pads minimum. Landing is sketch with the protruding rock underneath.
content.location: Entering the five bimbos corridor, it’s the Arete on the route on the left with a giant yucca plant growing right underneath it. Please don’t leave trash and don’t walk through the grass past the fence posts.

content.description:
These are the five big boulders lined up roughly northeast to the southwest. The left (northeast) two have a large juniper guarding their north side. The southernmost boulder has an oak in front of its northwest face.

 Reopened in 2017
